ground_truth: She swims across the water which nearly reaches the ceiling. She stops at the stairs, then turns. He swims to the stairs and they both climb. At the head of a crowd, Tommy and Fabrizio hop over a barrier. Crew members lift the lifeboat onto long oars set up like a ramp. Reaching to the deck, Murdoch rushes to a stairwell and stares down the churning water. Cal runs through a doorway. A man knocks him into a running crowd. Cal turns and runs with the others, then stops. He climbs a platform and peers over the crowd. Cal peers down at a crying young girl, then walks away. Inside, Rose and Jack run up a staircase. A man falls into the water, another dangles from the rope. Cal approaches. Murdoch pulls money from his pocket and flings it at Cal. Murdoch pushes Cal. A man leaps toward the lifeboat. Murdoch shoots at him. A man pushes Tommy forward. Murdoch shoots Tommy. Fabrizio kneels by Tommy. Murdoch gazes downward and steps back toward the edge of the ship. He looks to his right, then at the crowd of passengers. Cal glares at Murdoch. Murdoch stands at attention and salutes, then holds the gun to his own head. He fires and falls into the ocean. Cal turns and then runs to the crowd. On the other side of the ship, crew members tip another lifeboat onto the deck below. Cal picks up a crying girl, then steps toward the crowd of passengers. Cal hurries forward. Cal hands the girl to a woman, climbs into the lifeboat, and sits. The woman hands the girl to Cal. Jack and Rose run for the smoking room. Andrews stands by the fireplace, gazing at a painting. Andrews gives Rose his lifebelt. She hugs Andrews. Rose hurries through a revolving door. Jack glances back, nods, then follows Rose. Elsewhere, a steward holding two life belts hurries toward the Grand Staircase. Outside, a sailor rotates a winch as others work to turn over the top of the lifeboat. Captain Smith watches, then turns as a man wades through shallow water on deck. A woman holding a baby approaches the captain. Captain Smith stares at her, then turns and steps away. A man with a lifebelt runs up to the captain. The captain stops, glances at the lifebelt, then walks off. Knee-deep in water, he steps onto the bridge. Captain Smith gazes at a ship's wheel and various instruments, then steps into the wheelhouse and shuts the door. The string quartet finishes playing. Carrying their instruments, three of the quartet members walk away as people run past. Hartley, the violin player, places his instrument against his neck and resumes playing.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She swims across water nearly reaching the ceiling, stops at the stairs, and turns. He joins her, and they climb. Tommy and Fabrizio lead a crowd over a barrier. Crew members lift a lifeboat onto oars set as a ramp. Murdoch rushes to a stairwell, staring at the churning water. Cal runs through a doorway, gets knocked into a crowd, then climbs a platform to look over. He sees a crying girl but walks away. Inside, Rose and Jack ascend a staircase. A man falls into the water, another dangles from a rope. Cal approaches. Murdoch throws money at Cal, then pushes him. A man leaps for the lifeboat; Murdoch shoots at him. Tommy is pushed forward, and Murdoch shoots him. Fabrizio kneels by Tommy. Murdoch steps back, salutes, and shoots himself, falling into the ocean. Cal runs to the crowd. Crew members tip another lifeboat onto the deck. Cal picks up a crying girl, steps toward the crowd, hands her to a woman, climbs into the lifeboat, and sits. The woman returns the girl to Cal. Jack and Rose head for the smoking room. Andrews stands by a fireplace, gives Rose his lifebelt, and she hugs him. Rose hurries through a revolving door, Jack follows. A steward with life belts rushes to the Grand Staircase. Outside, a sailor turns a winch as others work on a lifeboat. Captain Smith watches, then turns as a man wades through shallow water. A woman with a baby approaches him. Captain Smith stares, then steps away. A man with a lifebelt runs to him; the captain glances at it and walks off. Knee-deep in water, he steps onto the bridge, gazes at the ship's wheel, and enters the wheelhouse, shutting the door. The string quartet finishes playing. Three members walk away with their instruments as people run past. Hartley, the violin player, resumes playing.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She swims across water nearly reaching the ceiling, stops at the stairs, then turns. He joins her, and they climb. Tommy and Fabrizio lead a crowd over a barrier. Crew members lift a lifeboat onto oars as a ramp. Murdoch rushes to a stairwell, staring at the water. Cal runs, gets knocked, then climbs a platform, sees a crying girl, and walks away. Inside, Rose and Jack run up stairs. A man falls into water, another dangles from a rope. Cal approaches. Murdoch throws money at Cal, pushes him, and shoots a man. Murdoch shoots Tommy, and Fabrizio kneels by him. Murdoch steps back, salutes, and shoots himself. Cal runs to the crowd. Crew members tip a lifeboat. Cal picks up a crying girl, hands her to a woman, climbs into the lifeboat, and sits. The woman returns the girl to Cal. Jack and Rose run to the smoking room. Andrews gives Rose his lifebelt, she hugs him, and they hurry through a door. A steward with life belts heads to the Grand Staircase. Outside, sailors work on a lifeboat. A man with a lifebelt runs to him, but the captain walks off, stepping onto the bridge. He gazes at the ship's wheel, enters the wheelhouse, and shuts the door. The string quartet finishes playing. Three members walk away, but Hartley resumes playing.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: She swims gracefully across the expanse of water, which rises perilously close to the ceiling above. Upon reaching the stairs, she pauses momentarily before turning around. He follows her lead, swimming determinedly to the stairs, and together they ascend. At the forefront of a gathering crowd, Tommy and Fabrizio energetically leap over a barrier. Crew members diligently lift the lifeboat, positioning it onto long oars that are set up ingeniously like a ramp. As he reaches the deck, Murdoch rushes with urgency to a stairwell, where he stares intently down at the churning, tumultuous water below. Cal, in a hurry, runs through a doorway, only to be knocked into a throng of people by another man. Cal quickly turns and joins the running crowd, but then he halts. He climbs onto a platform, peering over the mass of people. Cal looks down at a young girl who is crying, then he turns away and walks off. Inside, Rose and Jack are seen running up a staircase. A man falls into the water, while another dangles precariously from a rope. Cal approaches the scene. Murdoch, with a swift motion, pulls money from his pocket and throws it at Cal. Murdoch then pushes Cal aside. A man makes a desperate leap toward the lifeboat, prompting Murdoch to shoot at him. In the chaos, a man pushes Tommy forward, and Murdoch fires at Tommy. Fabrizio kneels beside Tommy, distraught. Murdoch gazes downward, stepping back toward the edge of the ship. He looks to his right, then surveys the crowd of passengers. Cal glares at Murdoch with intensity. Murdoch stands at attention, salutes solemnly, and then holds the gun to his own head. He fires and falls into the ocean below. Cal turns away and runs toward the crowd. On the opposite side of the ship, crew members carefully tip another lifeboat onto the deck below. Cal picks up a crying girl, stepping purposefully toward the crowd of passengers. Cal moves quickly forward, handing the girl to a woman, then climbs into the lifeboat and takes a seat. The woman hands the girl back to Cal. Meanwhile, Jack and Rose make a dash for the smoking room. Andrews stands by the fireplace, his gaze fixed on a painting. Andrews offers Rose his lifebelt, and she hugs him gratefully. Rose hurries through a revolving door, with Jack glancing back, nodding, and then following her. Elsewhere, a steward clutching two life belts hurries toward the Grand Staircase. Outside, a sailor rotates a winch as others work diligently to turn over the top of the lifeboat. Captain Smith observes the scene, then turns as a man wades through the shallow water on deck. A woman holding a baby approaches the captain, and Captain Smith stares at her momentarily before turning and stepping away. A man with a lifebelt runs up to the captain, who stops, glances at the lifebelt, and then walks off. Knee-deep in water, he steps onto the bridge. Captain Smith gazes thoughtfully at a ship's wheel and various instruments, then steps into the wheelhouse and shuts the door behind him. The string quartet finishes playing their piece. Carrying their instruments, three of the quartet members walk away as people rush past them. Hartley, the violin player, places his instrument against his neck and resumes playing, undeterred by the chaos around him.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: She swims with an elegant grace across the vast expanse of water, which precariously rises to a height dangerously close to the ceiling above her. Upon finally reaching the stairs, she pauses momentarily, taking a brief moment to collect herself before turning around. He closely follows her lead, swimming with determination and focus to the stairs, and together, side by side, they begin their ascent. At the forefront of a rapidly growing, gathered crowd, Tommy and Fabrizio energetically leap over a barrier with enthusiasm. Nearby, crew members work with diligence and care, lifting the lifeboat and positioning it onto long, sturdy oars that are set up ingeniously to function like a ramp. As soon as he reaches the deck, Murdoch rushes with a sense of urgency and purpose to a stairwell, where he stares intently down at the churning, tumultuous water swirling below. Cal, moving swiftly and in a hurry, rushes through a doorway, only to be forcefully knocked into a bustling throng of frantic people by another man. Quickly recovering, Cal turns around and joins the running crowd, moving with them at pace, but then he stops suddenly. He climbs onto a platform, peering over the mass of people gathered below him. Cal looks down at a young girl who is crying, then he turns away and walks off decisively. Inside the ship, Rose and Jack are seen running with urgency up a staircase. Meanwhile, a man falls into the turbulent water, while another dangles precariously from a thin rope. Cal approaches the scene with a focused intensity. Murdoch, with a swift and decisive motion, pulls money from his pocket and throws it dismissively at Cal, then pushes him aside. A man makes a desperate, flailing leap toward the lifeboat, prompting Murdoch to shoot at him with intent. Amidst the ensuing chaos, a man pushes Tommy forward, and Murdoch fires at Tommy, hitting him. Fabrizio kneels beside Tommy, visibly distraught and overwhelmed by grief. Murdoch gazes downward, stepping back towards the very edge of the ship. He looks to his right, then surveys the crowd of panicked passengers. Cal glares at Murdoch with an intense, burning look. Murdoch stands at attention, salutes solemnly, and then holds the gun to his own head. He fires and falls into the ocean below. Cal turns away and runs purposefully toward the crowd. On the opposite side of the ship, crew members carefully and cautiously tip another lifeboat onto the deck below. Cal picks up a crying girl with care, stepping forward purposefully toward the crowd of passengers. Moving quickly, Cal hands the girl over to a woman, then climbs into the lifeboat and takes a seat. The woman then hands the girl back to Cal securely. Meanwhile, Jack and Rose make a frantic dash for the smoking room. Inside, Andrews stands by the fireplace, his gaze fixed intently on a painting. Andrews kindly offers Rose his lifebelt, and she hugs him gratefully, deeply appreciating the gesture. Rose hurries through a revolving door, with Jack glancing back momentarily, nodding, and then following her closely. Elsewhere, a steward clutching two life belts urgently hurries toward the Grand Staircase. Outside, a sailor diligently rotates a winch as other crew members work tirelessly to turn over the top of the lifeboat. Captain Smith observes the scene with a thoughtful gaze, then turns as a man wades through the shallow water on the deck. A woman holding a baby approaches the captain, and Captain Smith stares at her momentarily before turning and stepping away with resolve. A man with a lifebelt runs up to the captain, who stops, glances briefly at the lifebelt he holds, and then walks off. Standing knee-deep in water, he steps onto the bridge. Captain Smith gazes thoughtfully at a ship's wheel and various instruments before stepping into the wheelhouse and shutting the door firmly behind him. The string quartet finishes playing their hauntingly beautiful piece. Carrying their instruments, three of the quartet members walk away as people rush past them in a flurry of motion. Hartley, the dedicated violin player, places his instrument lovingly against his neck and resumes playing, undeterred and unfazed by the chaos and turmoil surrounding him.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She begins by propelling herself through the water, which is so high it nearly touches the ceiling, using strong, deliberate strokes to make her way across. As she reaches the stairs, she comes to a halt, taking a moment to catch her breath before turning around. Meanwhile, he swims with purpose toward the same set of stairs, and upon reaching them, they both begin to climb, step by step, emerging from the water. At the forefront of a gathering crowd, Tommy and Fabrizio energetically leap over a barrier, their movements quick and agile. Nearby, crew members work together to lift a lifeboat, carefully positioning it onto long oars that have been set up to function as a makeshift ramp. Murdoch, reaching the deck, rushes with urgency to a stairwell, where he pauses to stare intently down at the churning water below. Cal, in a hurry, runs through a doorway, only to be knocked off balance by a man who collides with him, sending him into a running crowd. Regaining his composure, Cal turns and joins the others in their frantic run, but soon comes to a stop. He climbs onto a platform, taking a moment to peer over the crowd, his eyes scanning the scene below. His gaze falls upon a young girl who is crying, and after a brief hesitation, he turns and walks away. Inside, Rose and Jack are in motion, running up a staircase with determination. Amidst the chaos, a man loses his footing and falls into the water, while another clings desperately to a rope, dangling precariously. Cal approaches the scene, and Murdoch, in a moment of decision, pulls money from his pocket and throws it at Cal, the bills fluttering through the air. Murdoch then pushes Cal aside, making way for a man who leaps toward the lifeboat. In a swift, decisive action, Murdoch fires his gun at the man. Amidst the confusion, a man pushes Tommy forward, and Murdoch, with grim resolve, shoots Tommy. Fabrizio kneels beside Tommy, his expression one of shock and grief. Murdoch, his gaze downward, steps back toward the edge of the ship, his mind racing. He looks to his right, then surveys the crowd of passengers, his eyes meeting Cal's glare. Standing at attention, Murdoch salutes, a final gesture of duty, before holding the gun to his own head. He pulls the trigger and falls into the ocean below. Cal, witnessing the scene, turns and runs toward the crowd. On the opposite side of the ship, crew members are busy tipping another lifeboat onto the deck below. Cal, spotting a crying girl, picks her up and steps purposefully toward the crowd of passengers. He hurries forward, his pace quickening, and hands the girl to a woman before climbing into the lifeboat himself and taking a seat. The woman, in turn, hands the girl back to Cal, ensuring her safety. Meanwhile, Jack and Rose make a dash for the smoking room, their movements synchronized. Inside, Andrews stands by the fireplace, his eyes fixed on a painting, lost in thought. In a moment of urgency, Andrews hands Rose his lifebelt, a gesture of protection, and she responds with a heartfelt hug. Rose then hurries through a revolving door, her steps quick and determined. Jack, glancing back to acknowledge Andrews with a nod, follows Rose without hesitation. Elsewhere, a steward, clutching two life belts, hurries toward the Grand Staircase, his pace brisk. Outside, a sailor is busy rotating a winch, while others work diligently to turn over the top of the lifeboat. Captain Smith observes the scene, his eyes taking in the frantic activity, before turning his attention to a man wading through the shallow water on deck. A woman holding a baby approaches the captain, and he stares at her for a moment before turning and stepping away. A man with a lifebelt runs up to the captain, who stops briefly, glances at the lifebelt, and then walks off, his mind set on his next course of action. Knee-deep in water, he steps onto the bridge, his movements steady and deliberate. Captain Smith takes a moment to gaze at the ship's wheel and various instruments, absorbing the gravity of the situation, before stepping into the wheelhouse and shutting the door behind him. Meanwhile, the string quartet finishes playing their piece, and three of the quartet members, carrying their instruments, walk away as people rush past them. Hartley, the violin player, remains behind, placing his instrument against his neck and resuming his playing, the music a poignant backdrop to the unfolding drama.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She swims across the water nearly reaching the ceiling, stops at the stairs, and turns as he joins her. Together, they climb the stairs. Leading a crowd, Tommy and Fabrizio hop over a barrier while crew members position a lifeboat onto oars set up as a ramp. Murdoch rushes to a stairwell, staring at the churning water below, as Cal runs through a doorway, gets knocked into a crowd, and then climbs a platform to survey the scene. Spotting a crying young girl, Cal walks away. Inside, Rose and Jack ascend a staircase amidst chaos. Cal approaches as Murdoch flings money at him and pushes him aside. Murdoch shoots at a man leaping toward the lifeboat and then shoots Tommy, who is pushed forward. Fabrizio kneels by Tommy as Murdoch steps back, salutes, and then takes his own life. Cal runs to the crowd, picks up a crying girl, and hands her to a woman before climbing into a lifeboat. The woman returns the girl to Cal. Jack and Rose run to the smoking room, where Andrews gives Rose his lifebelt, and she hugs him before hurrying through a revolving door with Jack following. Elsewhere, a steward with life belts rushes toward the Grand Staircase, while outside, sailors work on a lifeboat as Captain Smith observes. A woman with a baby approaches him, but he turns away, stepping onto the bridge and into the wheelhouse, shutting the door behind him. The string quartet finishes playing, and three members walk away with their instruments as Hartley resumes playing his violin.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She swims across the water which nearly reaches the ceiling, echoing the dire situation on the sinking RMS Titanic as it took on water in the early hours of April 15, 1912. She stops at the stairs, then turns. He swims to the stairs and they both climb, struggling to find higher ground as the ship continues to flood. At the head of a crowd, Tommy and Fabrizio, two third-class passengers deeply affected by the chaos, hop over a barrier. Crew members lift the lifeboat onto long oars set up like a ramp, a last desperate attempt to save lives. Reaching to the deck known for its grandeur, Murdoch rushes to a stairwell and stares down the churning water, overwhelmed by the gravity of the disaster. Cal, a wealthy passenger seeking safety, runs through a doorway. A man knocks him into a running crowd. Cal turns and runs with the others, then stops. He climbs a platform and peers over the crowd, trying to assess the situation. Cal peers down at a crying young girl, then walks away, burdened by his own survival. Inside, Rose and Jack, lovers caught in the tragedy, run up a staircase. A man falls into the water, another dangles from the rope, a stark reminder of the ship's catastrophic list. Cal approaches. Murdoch, one of the ship's officers attempting to maintain order under pressure, pulls money from his pocket and flings it at Cal, revealing the chaos and corruption as desperation takes hold. Murdoch pushes Cal. A man leaps toward the lifeboat. Murdoch shoots at him in a controversial act of control amidst panic. A man pushes Tommy forward. Murdoch shoots Tommy in the confusion. Fabrizio kneels by Tommy, enveloped in grief. Murdoch gazes downward and steps back toward the edge of the ship, contemplating the dire situation. He looks to his right, then at the crowd of passengers. Cal glares at Murdoch. Murdoch stands at attention and salutes, then holds the gun to his own head, a tragic end for the overwhelmed officer. He fires and falls into the ocean. Cal turns and then runs to the crowd, driven by fear and survival. On the other side of the ship, crew members tip another lifeboat onto the deck below, as every lifeboat becomes precious with limited supply and growing demand. Cal picks up a crying girl, showing a flicker of humanity, then steps toward the crowd of passengers. Cal hurries forward. Cal hands the girl to a woman, climbs into the lifeboat, and sits, using his wealth and status to secure a spot. The woman hands the girl to Cal, reinforcing the chaos and urgency of the moment. Jack and Rose run for the smoking room, a once social area now deserted in chaos. Andrews, the ship's designer aware of its impending doom, stands by the fireplace, gazing at a painting, filled with regret. Andrews gives Rose his lifebelt, a symbol of his sacrifice. She hugs Andrews. Rose hurries through a revolving door, racing against time. Jack glances back, nods, then follows Rose. Elsewhere, a steward holding two life belts hurries toward the Grand Staircase, a symbol of opulence now marred by panic. Outside, a sailor rotates a winch as others work to turn over the top of the lifeboat, a critical task as each second counts. Captain Smith, the ship's experienced yet fated leader, watches, then turns as a man wades through shallow water on deck. A woman holding a baby approaches the captain, a poignant scene of vulnerability. Captain Smith stares at her, then turns and steps away, burdened by the weight of his decisions. A man with a lifebelt runs up to the captain. The captain stops, glances at the lifebelt, then walks off, accepting the inevitable fate. Knee-deep in water, he steps onto the bridge, the command center now engulfed in chaos. Captain Smith gazes at a ship's wheel and various instruments, symbols of a once-grand voyage, then steps into the wheelhouse and shuts the door, a final act of resignation. The string quartet finishes playing, their music a haunting testament to bravery. Carrying their instruments, three of the quartet members walk away as people run past, choosing composure over panic. Hartley, the violin player, places his instrument against his neck and resumes playing, his dedication a poignant memorial to those lost.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: She swims across the water which nearly reaches the ceiling. She stops at the stairs then turns. He swims to the stairs and they both climb. At the head of a crowd Tommy and Fabrizio hop over a barrier. Crew members lift the lifeboat onto long oars set up like a ramp. Reaching to the deck Murdoch rushes to a stairwell and stares down the churning water. Cal runs through a doorway. A man knocks him into a running crowd. Cal turns and runs with the others then stops. He climbs a platform and peers over the crowd. Cal peers down at a crying young girl then walks away. Inside. Rose and Jack run up a staircase. A man falls into the water. another dangles from the rope. Cal approaches. Murdoch pulls money from his pocket and flings it at Cal. Murdoch pushes Cal. A man leaps toward the lifeboat. Murdoch shoots at him. A man pushes Tommy forward. Murdoch shoots Tommy. Fabrizio kneels by Tommy. Murdoch gazes downward and steps back toward the edge of the ship. He looks to his right then at the crowd of passengers. Cal glares at Murdoch. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. Murdoch stands at attention and salutes then holds the gun to his own head. He fires and falls into the ocean. Cal turns and then runs to the crowd. On the other side of the ship crew members tip another lifeboat onto the deck below. Cal picks up a crying girl then steps toward the crowd of passengers. Cal hurries forward. Cal hands the girl to a woman climbs into the lifeboat and sits. The woman hands the girl to Cal. Jack and Rose run for the smoking room. Andrews stands by the fireplace gazing at a painting. Andrews gives Rose his lifebelt. She hugs Andrews. Rose hurries through a revolving door. Jack glances back nods then follows Rose. Elsewhere a steward holding two life belts hurries toward the Grand Staircase. Outside a sailor rotates a winch as others work to turn over the top of the lifeboat. Captain Smith watches then turns as a man wades through shallow water on deck. A woman holding a baby approaches the captain. Captain Smith stares at her then turns and steps away. A man with a lifebelt runs up to the captain. The captain stops glances at the lifebelt then walks off. Kneedeep in water he steps onto the bridge. Captain Smith gazes at a ship's wheel and various instruments then steps into the wheelhouse and shuts the door. The string quartet finishes playing. Carrying their instruments. three of the quartet members walk away as people run past Hartley. the violin player places his instrument against his neck and resumes playing.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: She swims across the water which nearly reaches the ceiling. She stops at the stairs then turns. He swims to the stairs and they both climb. At the head of a crowd Tommy and Fabrizio hop over a barrier. Crew members lift the lifeboat onto long oars set up like a ramp. Reaching to the deck Murdoch rushes to a stairwell and stares down the churning water. Cal runs through a doorway. A man knocks him into a running crowd. Cal turns and runs with the others then stops. He climbs a platform and peers over the crowd. Cal peers down at a crying young girl then walks away. Inside. Rose and Jack run up a staircase. A man falls into the water. another dangles from the rope. Cal approaches. Murdoch pulls money from his pocket and flings it at Cal. Murdoch pushes Cal. A man leaps toward the lifeboat. Murdoch shoots at him. A man pushes Tommy forward. Murdoch shoots Tommy. Fabrizio kneels by Tommy. Murdoch gazes downward and steps back toward the edge of the ship. He looks to his right then at the crowd of passengers. Cal glares at Murdoch. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She glides across the orchard which nearly touches the treetops. She pauses at the ladder, then pivots. He glides to the ladder and they both ascend. Leading a parade, Benny and Giovanni skip over a fence. Workers hoist the carriage onto long planks set up like a slide. Stretching to the rooftop, Farnsworth dashes to a hallway and observes the bubbling stew. Max jogs through an archway. A boy nudges him into a sprinting troupe. Max pivots and jogs with the others, then halts. He ascends a scaffold and peers over the troupe. Max peers down at a shouting old woman, then strides away. Indoors, Lily and John dash up an escalator. A boy tumbles into the stew, another swings from the vine. Max arrives. Farnsworth retrieves coins from his satchel and tosses them at Max. Farnsworth shoves Max. A boy bounds toward the carriage. Farnsworth aims at him. A boy shoves Benny onward. Farnsworth aims at Benny. Giovanni crouches by Benny. Farnsworth gazes upward and steps back toward the brink of the raft. He glances to his left, then at the troupe of travelers. Max scowls at Farnsworth. Farnsworth stands at alert and waves, then holds the pen to his own chest. He scribbles and tumbles into the puddle. Max pivots and then jogs to the troupe. On the far side of the raft, workers tilt another carriage onto the ground below. Max lifts a sobbing woman, then strides toward the troupe of travelers. Max rushes forward. Max hands the woman to a lady, climbs into the carriage, and settles. The lady hands the woman to Max. John and Lily sprint for the lounge. Randolph stands by the hearth, examining a statue. Randolph gives Lily his coat. She embraces Randolph. Lily dashes through a swinging gate. John peers back, bows, then trails Lily. Elsewhere, an attendant clutching two coats dashes toward the Grand Hallway. Outdoors, a seaman rotates a crank as others toil to flip over the top of the carriage. Admiral Jones observes, then pivots as a boy wades through shallow soup on the roof. A lady clutching a doll steps toward the admiral. Admiral Jones observes her, then pivots and strides away. A boy with a coat rushes up to the admiral. The admiral pauses, glances at the coat, then strolls away. Waist-deep in stew, he strides onto the balcony. Admiral Jones examines a helm and various gadgets, then steps into the pilothouse and closes the gate. The brass band finishes performing. Bearing their gadgets, three of the band members stroll away as travelers dash past. Marley, the trumpet player, positions his gadget against his shoulder and continues performing.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The scene unfolds in a tense, water-filled setting as Tommy and Fabrizio leap over a barrier to join a fleeing crowd. Crew members raise a lifeboat onto makeshift ramps. Murdoch, rushing to a stairwell, witnesses chaos as Cal runs with the crowd, only to stop and look over a crying girl before leaving her. Rose and Jack race up a staircase amid falling and dangling people. Cal encounters Murdoch, who rejects his bribe and pushes him aside. A man leaps for a lifeboat, and Murdoch shoots, ultimately firing at Tommy. Distressed, Murdoch salutes and ends his life. Cal, turning back to the crowd, aids a crying girl, eventually securing a place in a lifeboat with her. Jack and Rose head to the smoking room, where Andrews gives Rose a lifebelt before they leave. Meanwhile, Captain Smith watches a lifeboat operation, then solemnly retreats to the bridge, shutting himself in the wheelhouse. The string quartet plays on, with Hartley continuing to perform as chaos surrounds them.
